title: Pan Mass Challenge, Day 2
name: Pan Mass Challenge, Day 2
description:
A Map by Sierra

The first weekend of August I'll be participating in a 192-mile bicycle ride across much of Massachusetts to benefit research at the Dana Farber Cancer Institute. This is the route some 4,000 riders and I will follow for the second day's 81-mile leg. Go &lt;a href=&quot;http://tinyurl.com/2u47fu&quot;&gt;here&lt;/A&gt; more information and to help sponsor my ride.

properties.name: Bear left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Herring Brook.

properties.name: Bear left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...continuing on plain old Long Pond rather than Old Long Pond.

properties.name: Bear right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto the on ramp of the Bourne Bridge.

properties.name: Bear right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Setucket. You\'re in Yarmouth by now.

properties.name: CAREFUL!
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesYou\'re in one of those awful rotaries. Even at 6:00 AM...

properties.name: Careful!
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesAnother rotary. It\'ll be your first right.

properties.name: FINISH (76.7 miles)
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesTime to wind down!

properties.name: Ferry back to Boston
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesHere\'s where the ferries leave for Boston. This is Billy Starr, the all-around excellent human being who founded the Pan Mass Challenge in 1980 and has been running it ever since.

properties.name: Highway: Interstate 6
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesYou\'ll be seeing a lot of this road later once it starts to slow down and narrow.

properties.name: Keep going
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesUsually when I ride out to the Cape I like to fork off onto 6A at this point, but not today. By now you\'ll have noticed the road increasingly undulates in gigantic arcs.

properties.name: Keep going
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesCanal Service Road turns into Freezer Road by the utility plant.

properties.name: Keep going
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesCross Rt. 6A

properties.name: Keep going
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...but watch for piles of sand that sometimes blow onto the road from the right. This is the edge of the gigantic series of sand dunes that is this area\'s most prominent feature.

properties.name: Keep going
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...up Rt. 6A and learn to like it!

properties.name: Loop right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...continuing on Freezer Rd.

properties.name: Merge
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesChurch turns into Parker.

properties.name: Merge
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...with Stony Brook.

properties.name: Merge again
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...with Rt. 6A.

properties.name: Merge again
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...this time with Rt. 6A, aka Main Street. Unlike the first day, you\'ll see some serious traffic up this road.

properties.name: REST STOP #1 (22.8 miles)
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesThis is the Barnstable County Complex. (Hope you remembered to apply vaseline!)

properties.name: REST STOP #2 (40.4 miles)
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesTurn right to get in there. (This was by far the hippest rest area!)

properties.name: REST STOP #3 (56.5 miles)
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesWelcome to Wellfleet Elementary School. There is no excuse for any more rest stops after this.

properties.name: SPLIT
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesTo continue to the Provincetown Inn, take a right. To go to the "Family Finish" (aka no beer), take a left back onto Rt. 6 in the opposite direction. The beach you just went by is literally the end of Cape Cod: where it widens and abruptly ends like a hammerhead amidst a swirl of ocean currents.

properties.name: START
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...at MMA. There\'s no set start time on the second day, and some people leave before dawn.

properties.name: Squeeze by the sleaze!
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesAt this point the road squeezes onto a narrow neck of land along with Rt. 6A and a bazillion tiny little cottages lining the bay.

properties.name: Town of Brewster
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesKeep going and don\'t get confused by the fact that Setucket just turned to Satucket.

properties.name: Town of Dennis
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesProceed on...

properties.name: Town of Eastham
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesTurn right to continue on Bridge Rd. across some beautiful salt marshes.

properties.name: Town of Orleans
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesOn your way out of the rest stop turn onto the Cape Cod rail trail. This actually goes all the way from Dennis, but you\'ll be on it for only part of the second leg. It\'ll pass under Rt. 6A and you won\'t have to deal with that road again.

properties.name: Town of Provincetown
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesLast town, but you still have a ways to go! The tall pilgrim monument will be your guide.

properties.name: Town of Sandwich
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesThe part after the Sagamore Bridge is a bit unclear. I think you go way past the power, then bear south.

properties.name: Town of Truro
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...the second-to-last, you will note. Bear right onto George Nilson.

properties.name: Town of Wellfleet
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesThis is where the rail trail comes to an end. Turn right onto Lecounts Hollow Rd.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Long Pond.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Rt. 149, aka Meetinghouse. You\'re now in Barnstable.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesNot sure where this happens, but the trail empties out onto West Street, perhaps via Salty Ridge Rd. You\'re in the process of rounding Cape Cod\'s "elbow."

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Castle Rd.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Rt. 6\'s service road. You\'ll be going on this for a while. I recall it as having a regular series of ups and downs. Lay into a sprint on the downhills and you won\'t have to spend much energy going up the other side.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Ocean View. And let me tell you, they\'re not kidding! You\'ll be high up on a bluff for most of the way, and you\'ll start to notice how Cape Cod dunes go up and down a lot.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...back onto the Cape Cod Rail Trail.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...to continue on Race Point Road. If you were to bear right, the map seems to imply you\'d also be on Race Point Road. (You\'d also hit the northern beach after passing the airport.) As you will later learn after spending time in town, this is an alternative community where they do things a little differently. (And did I mention bagpipes mean bad news?)

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto S. Pamet.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Bridge Rd. You may be getting disoriented by now.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Rt. 6. There\'s just no getting around it. Careful of the traffic!

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Rt. 130, aka Water St. This is a spectacularly beautiful little town.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Rock Harbor Rd. after running parallel to Rt. 6 for a bit. You\'re about to zig-zag quite a bit in the next few miles.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Tupper.

properties.name: Turn left.
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...just after passing under the bridge.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Veteran\'s Way.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesA hard right continues you on Rock Harbor Rd. That\'s how crazy this place is.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Collins. This is one of the detours you will take to stay off Rt. 6 as much as possible.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Race Point Road. If you go straight, you\'ll get there a lot faster. But no, the planners of this event want to show you the natural beauty of this unique place. The rolling dunes. The fragile wildlife habitat. The entire eco-freaking-system, damn them. Up and down, up and down! After such a long ride, this final terrain is simply adding insult to injury, then for good measure, some more injury.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...in Truro Center just after passing under Rt. 6.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Rt. 6. You are increasingly running out of options but to take this much larger road.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto the Cape Cod Canal Bike Path. No turns until after the Sagamore Bridge.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...to continue on Castle Rd.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Skaket Beach Rd.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Main St.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...hard right onto Sandwich.

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Kingsbury Beach. (To your left a little over 1000 feet is Cape Cod Bay.)

properties.name: Turn right
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United States...onto Church St.

properties.name: WATER!
properties.description: Posted by Sierra United StatesThere are a couple of nice swimming holes here, if you\'re into that sort of thing.
